title: Critique this jungle route for me. I'm getting people criticizing me for starting red/blue.
body:
I'm going off of these two routes in this guide below:
http://www.solomid.net/guide/view/131147-leesin-build-guide-jungle-by-alshavin

If starting red:
Red (w/ Smite when HP gets low enough) > Wolves > Blue > Frog (w/ Smite) > Recall

If starting blue:
Blue > Frog (w/ Smite) > Wolves > Raptors > Recall

I'm especially loving the red start, because it gives me both red and blue buff, plus the smited frog buff. Let me know what you guys think.

replies.body:
Imo, you should start your buff if you don't have a lot of early damage or sustain. Champions like Nautilus or Evelynn that struggle to complete that first clear would benefit more from the leash on the buff. 

If you don't play champions that have that problem, as taking 4 camps would suggest you don't, you may as well just start the smaller camp. It takes less time to get down so your leashers can get to lane.

Well, if you start from Krugs/Gromp with an instant smite, you'll get the stunning/poison buff, which lasts the entire clear against all those jungle mobs, which will save you health, enabling quite a few junglers to even gank without going back to base first. My personal favorite is the (Smite)Gromp-Blue-Wolves-Red(Smite)-Gank combo. Mind you, I don't play Lee Sin, so it might not apply.

Only real issue I see would be your blue start. Why not start frog to help clear blue a bit faster? This would also let you go Frog>Blue>Red>Gank or continue farming on almost any champion. Okay atleast the ones I have played a fair amount. Red start is fine as long as you don't chug an HP pot while clearing red. Also typically that start for red is used for a level 2 gank on a lane. In reality any route will work, it just comes down to what you intend to do. If you plan on power farming blue early is more beneficial as it offers more CDR, letting you farm better. If you are an early game Jg (j4, Lee Sin, Rek'Sai for example) red is a more key buff for the slow and bit of true damage in ganks.
In my opinion, you should be ganking sometime before you recall. It's a waste of the buffs, especially red since it gives so much ganking power.

The theory, is that starting either Gromp or Krugs with smite gets you a buff which helps you clear better/faster and nets you lvl 2 in the process, giving you many tools for clearing your first buff by yourself, whereas starting the buff first gives you less benefits overall, and generally are more important to have when you gank. 

So ideally, you go gromp/krugs->buff#1->wolves/Razors->buff#2->gank

The gromp buff gives you a lot faster clears, whereas the Krugs buff gives you a good deal safer clears because of all the stuns.

Your clear pattern after the start can be quite variable though, and in general I think there's a lot of flexibility to your options, even more so when they nerf some of the damage next patch (in particular the razors are getting hit pretty good).
